Ethereum is also a programming language that developers can use to build these applications.
What sets Ethereum apart is its flexible functionality. Ethereum\u2019s blockchain can be programmed to complete any type of decentralized functionality. For example, developers can use Ethereum to create entire countries that exist on the blockchain. These countries can run their own governments, create their own currencies, and even send citizens to space.

Because no one governs the Bitcoin network, it\u2019s also a bit more anonymous than other payment networks like credit cards. However, this also means that the government can\u2019t track the use of Bitcoin the same way they could track a credit card transaction.
People can create \u201Cwallets\u201D to store and send Bitcoin. The network uses Ethereum\u2019s virtual machine for executing smart contracts and building decentralized apps. The virtual machine is known as the Qtum Virtual Machine (QVM) and runs on top of the Bitcoin blockchain.
As a result of this hybrid functionality, Qtum can complete functions that neither Bitcoin nor Ethereum can accomplish on their own.`),mdx("h2",null,"How Does Qtum Work?\u200B"),mdx("p",null,`The Qtum token is used for staking payments and securing the network. This could help Qtum expand beyond the Ethereum network and attract new users and developers.`),mdx("h2",null,"Who\u2019s Behind Qtum? Felder also holds a Master of Science in Electrical Engineering from the University of Washington.
Qtum\u2019s other co-founder and president of the network is Patrick Dai. Dai is a former Chinese equity investor who has served as an advisor to several companies in the blockchain space.`),mdx("h2",null,"How to Buy and Store Qtum\u200B"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re interested in buying Qtum, the first thing you\u2019ll need to do is create a wallet. Because Qtum uses Bitcoin\u2019s blockchain, you don\u2019t need to buy BTC as well. You can buy and store Qtum in its own wallet.`),mdx("h2",null,"Bottom line"),mdx("p",null,"Qtum is a hybrid blockchain project that combines Bitcoin and Ethereum\u2019s best features.
